original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up at close on Friday
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields closed higher on Friday ahead of a 180,000 million treasury bonds auction, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 closed at 31.75/32.00 percent on Friday, up from 31.70/80 percent on Thursday.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 28.00/29.00 percent, up from the last close at 26.10/25 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 27.75/28.25 percent, up from 27.00/27.40 percent.

State debt office said, 70,000 million Treasury Bonds under the series of 22.00 percent 2024’A’ and 110,000 million Treasury Bonds under the series of 18.00 percent 2027 ‘A’ are to be issued through an auction on March 13, 2023. (Colombo/Mar 10/2023)
